intro: Renealmia stellulata, commonly known as the star-leaf arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a starch source, similar to arrowroot. The foliage is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant coloration and unique leaf patterns.
